tests.description: [Cal.com] fix: search by branch instead of SHA in E2E report workflow_

vars.pr_body:
## What does this PR do?

Fixes the E2E Report workflow's `workflow_dispatch` mode failing with "No runs found with blob-report artifacts" when manually triggered.

**Root cause**: The workflow was searching for runs matching the PR's current `head_sha`, which fails when:
1. The PR was updated after E2E tests ran (artifacts exist for an older commit SHA)
2. The current run for that SHA is still queued/in-progress

**Fix**: Search by `branch` instead of `head_sha`, and filter for `status: 'completed'` runs only.

## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE)

- [x] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected).
- [x] I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). N/A - CI workflow change only.
- [x] I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.

## How should this be tested?

1. Find a PR that has E2E test results from a previous commit (not the current head SHA)
2. Go to Actions → "E2E Report" → "Run workflow"
3. Enter the PR number
4. Verify the workflow finds the blob-report artifacts and publishes the report

## Human Review Checklist

- [ ] Verify branch-based search is acceptable (could theoretically match wrong run if fork PRs have same branch name, but this is rare)
- [ ] Confirm `status: 'completed'` filter correctly excludes queued/in-progress runs

---

tests.description: [PostHog Analytics] feat(kafka-deduplicator): Commit batches only after processi

vars.pr_body:
## Problem

The kafka-deduplicator was committing offsets immediately after receiving messages rather than after successful processing. This could lead to data loss if the service crashed between receiving and processing messages.

## Changes

- Added `OffsetTracker` that tracks processed offsets per partition with rebalancing protection
- Partition workers now call `mark_processed()` after successful batch processing
- `BatchConsumer` commits from `OffsetTracker` instead of on receive
- Rebalance handler sets rebalancing flag to prevent commits during partition changes

## How did you test this code?

<!-- Briefly describe the steps you took. -->
<!-- Include automated tests if possible, otherwise describe the manual testing routine. -->

<!-- Docs reminder: If this change requires updated docs, please do that! Engineers are the primary people responsible for their documentation. 🙌 -->

👉 _Stay up-to-date with [PostHog coding conventions](https://posthog.com/docs/contribute/coding-conventions) for a smoother review._

## Changelog: (features only) Is this feature complete?

<!-- Yes if this is okay to go in the changelog. No if it's still hidden behind a feature flag, or part of a feature that's not complete yet, etc.  -->
<!-- Removing this section does not mean the changelog bot won't pick it up, because *some people* like to not use the template, so we can't rely on it existing. -->

tests.description: [Polar.sh] Disable failing webhooks faster

vars.pr_body:
In main, we don't exclude pending webhook events (`succeeded is None`) from the check on consecutive failures, which makes it so that in burst of webhook triggers, some webhooks collect up to 400-500 events and a multiple of that in delivery attempts before there's a long enough pause that the 10 latest events are all effectively failed without any new ones in a pending state.

This fixes it by looking at the 10 latest completed events (succeeded or failed) which I think is correct behavior and was an initial oversight in implementing the auto-disable. We also mark pending webhooks as skipped to make sure they won't be (re-)tried.

tests.description: [Cal.com] refactor: use explicit type annotations for TUpdateInputSche

vars.pr_body:
## What does this PR do?

Refactors `TUpdateInputSchema` in the tRPC event types package to use explicit TypeScript type annotations instead of relying on `z.infer<>` to compute types through complex schema chains. This is part of an effort to reduce TypeScript type-checking time, which was identified as the main performance bottleneck (20.5 seconds / 59% of total build time) in the tRPC package.

The key optimization is using `z.ZodType<T>` annotations on schemas, which tells TypeScript the type directly rather than having it infer through chains of `.extend()`, `.partial()`, `.merge()`, etc.

**Changes:**
- Define explicit TypeScript types for all nested structures (`HashedLinkInput`, `AiPhoneCallConfig`, `CalVideoSettings`, `HostInput`, `HostGroupInput`, `ChildInput`, `DestinationCalendarInput`, `RecurringEventInput`, `EventTypeColorInput`, `BookingFieldInput`, `RRSegmentQueryValueInput`)
- Create comprehensive `TUpdateInputSchema` type with all ~80+ fields explicitly defined
- Use `z.ZodType<TUpdateInputSchema>` annotation on `BaseEventTypeUpdateInput` schema
- Remove dependency on `EventTypeSchema` from `@calcom/prisma/zod/modelSchema/` which was pulling in many generated types
- Change from `.refine()` to `.superRefine()` for aiPhoneCallConfig transformations
- Change `users` field type from `(string | number)[]` to `number[]` to match actual usage in handlers
- Handle `bookingFields` null case in update handler by converting to `Prisma.DbNull` for JSON field compatibility

Runtime validation behavior is preserved - only compile-time type inference is optimized.

### Updates since last revision

- **Fixed API v2 DTO compatibility**: Removed index signature `[key: string]: unknown` from `BookingFieldInput` type. The index signature was causing `BookingField_2024_04_15` (a NestJS DTO class) to be incompatible with `BookingFieldInput`. The index signature was unnecessary since `field.name` is used as an index key on `discoveredFields` (a `Record<string, true>`), not on the field object itself.

- **Removed useless JSDoc comments**: Cleaned up redundant JSDoc comments on type definitions per PR feedback. Kept only the meaningful documentation on `BookingFieldInput` and `RRSegmentQueryValueInput` that explain important design decisions.

- **Added unit tests for aiPhoneCallConfig transformation**: Added 8 unit tests in `types.test.ts` to verify the `.superRefine()` transformation behavior is equivalent to the original `.refine()` behavior. Tests cover default value handling for `yourPhoneNumber`, `numberToCall`, `guestName`, `guestEmail`, and `guestCompany` fields.

## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE)

- [x] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected).
- [x] I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). N/A - no documentation changes needed.
- [x] I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.

## How should this be tested?

1. Run `yarn type-check:ci --force` to verify TypeScript compilation passes
2. Run `yarn lint` to verify linting passes
3. Run `TZ=UTC yarn test packages/trpc/server/routers/viewer/eventTypes/__tests__/types.test.ts` to run the new unit tests
4. Verify that event type update operations still work correctly in the application (the runtime validation should be unchanged)

To measure the performance improvement, compare tRPC build times before and after:
```bash
cd packages/trpc && time yarn build
```


## Human Review Checklist

- [ ] Verify all fields from the original `EventTypeSchema` are present in `TUpdateInputSchema` with correct types
- [ ] Check that nullability (`null`, `undefined`, optional) matches the original schema behavior
- [ ] Verify the `superRefine` transformation is equivalent to the original `refine` behavior (unit tests now cover this)
- [ ] Check if any consumers of `TUpdateInputSchema` break due to type cha

tests.description: [Cal.com] perf(features): add TypeScript project references to reduce

vars.pr_body:
## What does this PR do?

This PR implements TypeScript project references for `@calcom/features` to prevent SDK types from leaking into dependent packages like `@calcom/trpc`. This is a follow-up to #26117 which applied a similar pattern to app-store services.

### Problem
When TypeScript compiles `@calcom/trpc`, it must resolve the entire Twilio SDK type graph (~555 .d.ts files) because `@calcom/features` exports functions that return Twilio SDK types. This significantly increases compilation time.

### Solution
1. **Local interface types**: Created `twilioProvider.types.ts` with minimal interfaces that only expose properties actually used by consumers
2. **Explicit return types**: Added return type annotations to all 11 exported functions in `twilioProvider.ts`
3. **TypeScript project references**: Added `tsconfig.build.json` and `typesVersions` configuration so that when types are pre-built, trpc consumes `.d.ts` files instead of typechecking source files

### Results (when types are built)
- Twilio SDK files in trpc compilation: **555 → 0**
- Total files in trpc compilation: **~7,735 → 4,655 (40% reduction)**

### Changes
- Created `twilioProvider.types.ts` with local interface types
- Added explicit return type annotations to all exported functions
- Added `tsconfig.build.json` to build declaration files for `@calcom/features`
- Added `typesVersions` to `@calcom/features/package.json` with fallback pattern
- Added `typesVersions` to `@calcom/ee/package.json` to redirect to prebuilt types
- Added `.gitignore` for generated types directory

The `typesVersions` fallback pattern allows the codebase to work without prebuilt types (falls back to source files), but when types are built ahead of time with `yarn build:types`, trpc consumes the `.d.ts` files instead.

### Updates since last revision
- Fixed `build:types` script to clean `types/` directory before building, preventing TS5055 "Cannot write file because it would overwrite input file" errors on repeated runs
- Added explicit excludes for `**/*.d.ts` and `**/*.d.ts.map` in tsconfig.build.json

### Known Issue
Running `yarn build:types` will show ~400+ pre-existing type errors in `packages/trpc` and `packages/prisma` (Prisma type mismatches). **These errors exist on main and are NOT caused by this PR.** TypeScript still emits the `.d.ts` files despite these errors, and the performance benefits are achieved.

## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE)

- [x] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected).
- [x] I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). N/A - no documentation changes needed.
- [x] I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works. N/A - this is a type-only change with no runtime behavior changes.

## How should this be tested?

This is a TypeScript performance optimization with no runtime behavior changes. To verify:

1. Build types: `cd packages/features && yarn build:types`
2. Run `yarn tsc --project tsconfig.server.json --listFiles 2>/dev/null | grep "node_modules/twilio" | wc -l` in `packages/trpc` - should show 0 files
3. Run `yarn tsc --project tsconfig.server.json --extendedDiagnostics` to compare compilation times
4. Verify no type errors are introduced in consuming code

## Human Review Checklist


- [ ] Verify that consumers of `sendSMS`/`scheduleSMS` only use the `sid` property from the returned message response
- [ ] Verify the `typesVersions` paths resolve correctly (especially `../features/types/ee/*` for `@calcom/ee`)
- [ ] Verify CI/build pipeline will run `build:types` before trpc typecheck to get the performance benefits
- [ ] Verify the fallback behavior (using source files when types aren't built) is acceptable for local development
- [ ] Confirm the pre-existing Prisma type errors (~400+) shown during `build:types` are acceptable (they exist on main)

## Checklist

- [

tests.description: [Gumroad] Feat: Add churn to analytics

vars.pr_body: Fixes #13 Reopened #1668 Used Stripe's methodology for calculating churn rate as mentioned by Sahil here https://github.com/antiwork/gumroad/issues/13#issuecomment-3372005841 > The churn rate is measured by the sum of churned subscribers in the past 30 days divided by the number of active subscribers as of 30 days ago, plus any new subscribers in those 30 days. Implemented a caching layer for large sellers to improve performance, as recalculating data across numerous products would otherwise degrade the user experience. Data fetching is done using Inertia’s partial reload method. A 31-day time window was introduced to ensure all monthly periods are fully captured. Since this window inherently represents a monthly range, daily or monthly aggregation filters were not included. Similarly, the DatePicker doesn't include options that represent more than a month in the date filter. ### Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/242b4032-26a8-42a1-8eb8-40944f907978 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e8080ddc-c6cf-4262-a995-14e92c65f6ef ### Tests `bundle exec rspec spec/controllers/churn_controller_spec.rb spec/services/creator_analytics/churn_spec.rb spec/models/creator_analytics_churn_cache_spec.rb --format html --out spec_results.html` ### AI Disclosure Use Cursor(auto-mode) for the initial setup of files and folders for this feature

tests.description: [Gumroad] Migrate _sidebar.scss to tailwind

vars.pr_body: # Migrate _sidebar.scss to Tailwind **Ref:** [Issue #1055](https://github.com/antiwork/gumroad/issues/1055) ## Overview This PR migrates the `_sidebar.scss` stylesheet to Tailwind CSS classes, maintaining exact visual consistency while eliminating custom SCSS dependencies. ## 📁 Files Modified - `app/javascript/components/Checkout/TemporaryLibrary.tsx` - `app/javascript/components/Checkout/index.tsx` - `app/javascript/components/Product/CardGrid.tsx` - `app/javascript/components/server-components/EmailsPage/EmailForm.tsx` - `app/javascript/components/server-components/LibraryPage.tsx` - `app/views/public/api.html.erb` - `app/javascript/packs/design.scss` ## Files Deleted - `app/javascript/stylesheets/_sidebar.scss` - No longer needed ## Migration Mapping | Original Rendered CSS | Tailwind Equivalent | |----------------------|-------------------| | `display: grid` | `grid` | | `gap: 2rem 4rem` | `gap-y-8 gap-x-16` | | `align-items: flex-start` | `items-start` | | `grid-template-columns: 1fr` | `grid-cols-1` | | `grid-auto-columns: 3fr` | `auto-cols-[3fr]` | | `grid-template-columns: 2fr` (right modifier) | `grid-cols-[2fr]` | | `grid-auto-columns: 1fr` (right modifier) | `auto-cols-[1fr]` | | `grid-auto-flow: column` (lg breakpoint) | `lg:grid-flow-col` | ## Design Consistency The migration maintains exact visual appearance and behavior: - **Spacing**: `gap-y-8 gap-x-16` perfectly matches the original `gap: 2rem 4rem` - **Grid behavior**: Same responsive grid system with proper column sizing - **Right modifier**: Special layout for checkout page preserved with custom `minmax(26rem,1fr)` sizing --- ## Visual Comparisons ### API Page (`app/views/public/api.html.erb`) | Before | After | |--------|-------| | | | --- ### Temporary Library (`app/javascript/components/Checkout/TemporaryLibrary.tsx`) #### Desktop View | Before | After | |--------|-------| | | | #### Mobile View | Before | After | |--------|-------| | | | --- ### Checkout (`app/javascript/components/Checkout/index.tsx`) #### Desktop View | Before | After | |--------|-------| | | | #### Mobile View | Before | After | |--------|-------| | | | --- ### Product Card Grid (`app/javascript/components/Product/CardGrid.tsx`) #### Desktop View | Before | After | |--------|-------| | | | #### Mobile View | Before | After | |--------|-------| |

tests.description: [Cal.com] refactor: Move attribute and routing-forms code from `app-st

vars.pr_body:
## What does this PR do?

This PR reorganizes code to improve module boundaries and prevent circular dependencies:

1. **Attribute repositories and services**: Moves `PrismaAttributeRepository`, `PrismaAttributeToUserRepository`, `PrismaAttributeOptionRepository`, and related attribute services from `packages/lib/server/repository/` and `packages/lib/service/attribute/server/` to `packages/features/attributes/`

2. **Routing forms logic**: Moves `findTeamMembersMatchingAttributeLogic` and `handleResponse` from `packages/app-store/` to `packages/features/routing-forms/lib/`

3. **Query resolution utilities**: Moves `resolveQueryValue.ts` from `packages/lib/raqb/` to `packages/app-store/routing-forms/lib/`

### Why this change is needed

- **Circular dependency prevention**: `app-store` should not import from `features`, but `features` can import from `app-store`. Moving routing-forms logic that depends on features code into `features` itself prevents circular dependencies.
- **Better module boundaries**: Feature-specific repositories and services belong in `features/` where the related feature code resides, not in generic `lib/` directories.
- This refactor is part of a larger effort to keep feature code self-contained within their specific directories in `features/`.

### Type changes

Moved and consolidated types to `packages/app-store/routing-forms/types/types.d.ts`:
- `AttributeOptionValue` - represents attribute option with `isGroup`, `value`, and `contains` fields
- `AttributeOptionValueWithType` - wraps `AttributeOptionValue` with `type` field
- `AttributeOptionAssignment` - updated to explicitly define the `attribute` property structure with `id`, `type`, and `isLocked` fields
- `AttributeName`, `AttributeId`, `BulkAttributeAssigner` - moved from deleted `packages/lib/service/attribute/types.d.ts`

### Updates since last revision

Fixed build errors caused by the refactoring:
- **AppPage.tsx / MultiDisconnectIntegration.tsx**: Changed from `inferRouterOutputs<AppRouter>` to `RouterOutputs` from `@calcom/trpc/react` for consistent type inference with tRPC hooks
- **packages/lib/service/attribute/utils.ts**: Updated import path to point to the new types location at `@calcom/app-store/routing-forms/types/types`
- **AttributeOptionAssignment type**: Explicitly defined the `attribute` property structure and removed unused `assignedUsers` from Pick to match actual data shape
- Added eslint-disable comments for pre-existing warnings in AppPage.tsx

## Human Review Checklist

- [ ] Verify all import paths have been updated correctly (search for old paths like `@calcom/lib/server/repository/PrismaAttribute` or `@calcom/app-store/_utils/raqb/findTeamMembersMatchingAttributeLogic`)
- [ ] Confirm the `AttributeOptionAssignment` type change doesn't break any consumers expecting the old structure (now explicitly defines `attribute: { id, type, isLocked }` instead of using Prisma's `Attribute` type)
- [ ] Verify the `RouterOutputs` type change in AppPage.tsx/MultiDisconnectIntegration.tsx maintains correct type inference for credentials
- [ ] Verify test mock paths are correctly updated in relocated test files

## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE)

- [x] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected).
- [x] N/A - I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). If N/A, write N/A here and check the checkbox.
- [x] N/A - I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.

---

Requested by: benny@cal.com (@hbjORbj)

tests.description: [Cal.com] feat: enhance CreatedAuditActionService with Salesforce app

vars.pr_body:
## What does this PR do?

Enhances the booking audit system to capture Salesforce CRM data during booking creation, specifically for Team Round Robin events. This builds on PR #25125 (booking-audit-more-infra).

**Changes:**
- Adds Salesforce audit data schema to `CreatedAuditActionService` to track lead/contact creation and field writes
- Creates `extractSalesforceAuditData` helper to extract Salesforce data from EventManager results
- Modifies Salesforce CRM service to capture and return fields written to event records and lead/contact records
- Updates `RegularBookingService` to pass extracted Salesforce data to the audit system

**Data captured:**
- Lead/Contact record ID and type when created
- Fields written to the Salesforce Event record with their values
- Fields written to the Lead/Contact record with their values

Link to Devin run: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/2b352c202412416d95ac10c6202178d2
Requested by: hariom@cal.com (@hariombalhara)

## Mandatory Tasks (DO NOT REMOVE)

- [x] I have self-reviewed the code (A decent size PR without self-review might be rejected).
- [x] I have updated the developer docs in /docs if this PR makes changes that would require a [documentation change](https://cal.com/docs). N/A - internal audit logging changes only.
- [ ] I confirm automated tests are in place that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.

## How should this be tested?

1. Create a Team Round Robin event type with Salesforce integration configured
2. Configure Salesforce app options to write to event records and/or lead/contact records on booking
3. Create a booking for the event type
4. Check the booking audit log to verify Salesforce data is captured:
   - `apps.salesforce.leadOrContactCreated` should contain the contact/lead ID and type
   - `apps.salesforce.eventRecordFields` should contain fields written to the SF Event
   - `apps.salesforce.leadOrContactFields` should contain fields written to the lead/contact

**Environment variables needed:**
- Salesforce app credentials configured

## Checklist

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [x] I have checked if my changes generate no new warnings

## Items for Human Review

- [ ] Verify `writeToRecordAndReturnFields` correctly mirrors `writeToRecord` behavior (CrmService.ts lines 1099-1168)
- [ ] Confirm no other callers of `salesforceCreateEvent` exist that might be affected by the return type change
- [ ] Consider whether `createdRecord` should be populated when new leads/contacts are created (currently only captures existing contacts)
- [ ] Unit tests for `extractSalesforceAuditData` helper function are not included

tests.description: [PostHog Analytics] feat(surveys): emit survey abandoned event

vars.pr_body:
## Problem

for surveys with partial responses enabled, there's no good way to know "the user is definitely done with this survey". examples:

1. :white_check_mark: user completes the whole thing
    1. listen for `survey sent` where complete=true
2. :white_check_mark: user dismisses after completing some of it
    1. listen for `survey dismissed` where partially complete = true
3. :x: user completes some, then closes the browser
    1. no event here! you'd have to build custom logic with timeouts or tie into pageleaves or something

<!-- Who are we building for, what are their needs, why is this important? -->

## Changes

emits a new `survey abandoned` event that can fill the gap

<!-- What is changed and what information would be useful to a reviewer? -->

tests.description: [Cal.com] refactor: trpc test file is importing @calcom/web

vars.pr_body:
## What does this PR do?

Prevents the trpc package from importing apps/web to avoid circular dependencies.

**Changes:**
1. Added an ESLint `forbid` rule in `packages/trpc/eslint.config.mjs` to block imports from `../apps/web/**`
2. Refactored `setDestinationCalendar.handler.test.ts` to remove `@calcom/web` imports and use local mocks instead

tests.description: [Polar.sh] events: Add events hypertable

vars.pr_body:
We create a shadow copy of the events table, that we make into a timescaledb
hypertable. We will double write to both events table for a period of time
until we are ready to drop the old events table.

Initially we let the hypertable be bucketed by week, this can be changed going forward if
the event volumes pick up.

The `events_hyper` table is a 1:1 copy of the `events` table, except the foreign key references since that is not supported by timescaledb.

tests.description: [PostHog Analytics] customer data infra -> data stack

vars.pr_body: ## Changes This is a fairly sweeping change that moves our positioning from "customer data infrastructure" to a more industry-standard "data stack." **It is very important we get this change out ASAP.** The positioning may not be perfect, and may not be exactly what we want to stick with in the long run, but it's far, far better than what is currently on the website. The current positioning was created when we were trying to position into "you don't need data engineers, we build for product engineers." That is no longer our positioning, and we are directly building a stack that data engineers will use, so we need to make this change. So: * I'm open to suggestions to improve copy, language, and structure * I'm not looking for opinions on positioning _in this PR_ (we can discuss elsewhere later) * I'm not looking for suggestions to keep the "customer data infra" language - I've intentionally moved away from that _for now_ * Please review for breaking technical, URL, and other changes I may not be aware of ### Main changes: Customer data infra ->> PostHog data stack Main page covers who we are building for, and lists the typical "modern data stack" components as products lower on the page and in the left side nav. Curious if people like the "perfect for / not quite ready for" product descriptions? CDP page (/cdp) used to just be a list of destinations and sources, it now describes our CDP features as well. TODO still: - Change the `/data-warehouse` URL to not point to the sql editor page - Create redirects

## Changes
Disable the screensaver on the `/demo` video page while the video is playing, resolving GitHub issue #13694 .

Solution  
- Listen for playback state changes and suppress the screensaver only when the video is actively playing.  
- Re-enable the screensaver when playback pauses or ends.  
- Ensure the behavior is scoped strictly to the `/demo` route.  
- Update the attached demo video to shorten the screensaver delay for demonstration purposes only.

tests.description: [Gumroad] chore: migrate _figure.scss to tailwind css

vars.pr_body: Fixes: https://github.com/antiwork/gumroad/issues/1409 Migrated all `figure.code` styling from `_figure.scss` to Tailwind CSS across 4 ERB files, removing few lines of SCSS and enabling future removal of `_figure.scss`. ``` // From _definitions.scss $grays: (0.1, 0.2, 0.5); // Array of opacity values @function gray($index, $name: "color") { @return rgb(var(--#{$name}) / nth($grays, $index)); } ``` So gray(1) means: - Take the 1st value from $grays array = 0.1 - Use default color = "color" - Result: rgb(var(--color) / 0.1) - `--color` = current text color in the context - `rgb(var(--color) / 0.1)` = text color at 10% opacity - From tailwind translation: ``` // From tailwind.config.js colors: { foreground: "rgb(var(--color))", // foreground = text color } ``` **Before Code** ``` /* BEFORE - SCSS */ figure.code { border: $border; @include bg-color(filled); border-radius: border-radius(1); overflow: hidden; figcaption { padding: spacer(4); } pre { padding: spacer(4); background-color: gray(1); overflow-x: auto; } > :not(:first-child) { border-top: $border; } } ``` **After Code** ``` ``` ### **Color Mapping** | SCSS Function | Tailwind Class | CSS Output | Description | |---------------|----------------|------------|-------------| | `@include bg-color(filled)` | `bg-background` | `rgb(var(--filled))` | Theme-aware background | | `gray(1)` | `bg-foreground/10` | `rgb(var(--color) / 0.1)` | 10% opacity text color | | `$border` | `border` | `rgb(var(--color) / var(--border-alpha))` | Theme border | ### **Spacing & Layout** | SCSS | Tailwind | CSS Value | |------|----------|-----------| | `padding: spacer(4)` | `p-4` | `1rem` | | `border-radius: border-radius(1)` | `rounded` | `0.25rem` | | `overflow: hidden` | `overflow-hidden` | `hidden` | | `overflow-x: auto` | `overflow-x-auto` | `auto` | | `border-top: $border` | `border-t` | Top border | ## **Testing URLs** ### **Public API Documentation** ``` http://gumroad.dev/api http://gumroad.dev/api#api-errors ``` **Features:** API endpoint URLs, cURL examples, response samples ### **Admin Tools (Admin Auth Required)** ``` http://gumroad.dev/admin/block_email_domains http://gumroad.dev/admin/unblock_email_domains http://gumroad.dev/admin/suspend_users ``` **Features:** Input format examples for domain/user management The critical insight was mapping SCSS's `gray(1)` function: ```scss gray(1) → rgb(var(--color) / 0.1) ``` To Tailwind's opacity shorthand: ```html bg-foreground/10 → rgb(var(--color) / 0.1) ``` This preserves the **context-aware** coloring where code backgrounds subtly match the current text color at 10% opacity, creating consistent visual hierarchy across different theme contexts. *** **_errors.html.erb** ### Before ### After *** **_method.html.erb** ### Before ### After *** **_form.html.erb** ### Before

tests.description: [PostHog Analytics] fix: fix webpack plugin

vars.pr_body:
## Problem

- Server sourcemaps are not generated with current webpack plugin:
	- Plugin cannot modify its own configuration
- Server output directory does not contain all server chunks

## Changes

- find common ancestor for all generated chunks to avoid using process.cwd and fall into the node_modules black hole
- update webpack config at nextjs-config level

tests.description: [Anthropic] Update memory cookbook with context editing and extended thi

vars.pr_body:
## Summary

This PR enhances the memory cookbook with comprehensive examples of the new **Context Editing API** and **Extended Thinking** features for Claude. The cookbook now demonstrates how to use these powerful features to build more efficient and intelligent memory-enabled applications.

## Key Changes

### 1. Context Editing API Integration
- Added complete examples showing how to use the Context Editing API to manage conversation context
- Demonstrated both clearing and replacing content within conversations
- Showed how context editing helps reduce token usage and improve conversation efficiency
- Updated the code review demo to leverage context editing for better memory management

### 2. Extended Thinking Support
- Integrated extended thinking capability into the memory demo framework
- Added examples showing how thinking blocks work with tool use
- Demonstrated proper handling of thinking blocks including signature fields
- Updated helper functions to properly process and include thinking content

### 3. Demo Framework Enhancements
- Enhanced `demo_helpers.py` with support for:
  - Context management configuration
  - Extended thinking parameter
  - Proper thinking block handling with signatures
  - Context editing metrics tracking
- Added comprehensive token usage and savings reporting
- Improved verbose output for better debugging

### 4. Code Review Demo Updates
- Updated `code_review_demo.py` to use modern type hints (`dict`, `list` vs `Dict`, `List`)
- Fixed import ordering and removed unused imports
- Added context editing capabilities to the code reviewer
- Improved error handling and code quality

### 5. Documentation Updates
- Updated `.env.example` with new configuration options
- Enhanced inline documentation explaining context editing features
- Added clear examples of token savings from context management

## Technical Details

**Context Editing API Usage:**
- Utilizes the `context-management-2025-06-27` beta flag
- Implements `extra_body` parameter for context management configuration
- Demonstrates threshold-based automatic context clearing
- Shows before/after token counts for transparency

**Extended Thinking Integration:**
- Properly handles thinking blocks in conversation flow
- Includes signature fields when required
- Maintains compatibility with tool use
- Provides thinking previews in verbose mode

## Testing Performed

- ✅ Ran ruff linting and formatting on all modified Python files
- ✅ Verified notebook structure with validation script
- ✅ Tested memory cookbook notebook executes without errors
- ✅ Confirmed context editing examples work correctly
- ✅ Validated extended thinking integration

## Files Modified

- `tool_use/memory_cookbook.ipynb` - Main cookbook with new examples (919 lines changed)
- `tool_use/memory_demo/demo_helpers.py` - Enhanced helper functions (87 lines changed)
- `tool_use/memory_demo/code_review_demo.py` - Updated code review demo (34 lines changed)
- `tool_use/memory_demo/__init__.py` - Added package initialization
- `tool_use/.env.example` - Updated configuration template

## Impact

This update provides developers with:
- Clear examples of how to use Context Editing for efficient memory management
- Practical demonstrations of Extended Thinking with tool use
- Best practices for building memory-enabled Claude applications
- Real-world code review scenarios showing token savings

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

tests.description: [Trigger.dev] fix(api): Fix preview branch targeting in environment variab

vars.pr_body: This PR fixes the `x-trigger-branch` header support for targeting specific preview branches when managing environment variables. The header was documented but not actually being extracted or used in the environment variable API routes. Additionally, the query logic in `authenticatedEnvironmentForAuthentication` was fundamentally broken—it searched for environments with both `slug: "preview"` (parent environment property) AND a specific `branchName` (child environment property), which no environment could satisfy simultaneously. The fix extracts the branch name using `branchNameFromRequest()` and correctly queries for child branch environments using `type: "PREVIEW"` and the specific `branchName`. This ensures that environment variable operations (create, update, get, list) properly target individual preview branches instead of affecting all preview environments.

tests.description: [Trigger.dev] fix(webapp): runs not appearing in local development

vars.pr_body:
## 🐛 Bug Description

Task runs execute successfully but **do not appear on the dashboard's "Runs" page** in local development environments.

**Root Cause:** The dashboard was always querying ClickHouse by default, but in local development:
1. ClickHouse replication is **disabled by default** (`RUN_REPLICATION_ENABLED` not set)
2. Without replication, ClickHouse tables remain **empty**
3. Result: Dashboard shows **"No runs found"** even though runs exist in PostgreSQL ❌


## ✅ Checklist

- [X] I have followed every step in the [contributing guide](https://github.com/triggerdotdev/trigger.dev/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [X] The PR title follows the convention.
- [X] I ran and tested the code works

---

## Testing

### ✅ Bug Fixed in Local Development
1. Followed `CONTRIBUTING.md` setup (without `RUN_REPLICATION_ENABLED=1`)
2. Started services with `pnpm run docker`
3. Started webapp with `pnpm run dev --filter webapp`
4. Triggered a task run
5. **Result:** ✅ Runs now appear on the dashboard (was showing "No runs found" before)

### ✅ Production Behavior Unchanged
1. Set `RUN_REPLICATION_ENABLED=1` and `RUN_REPLICATION_CLICKHOUSE_URL`
2. Triggered a task run
3. **Result:** ✅ Still uses ClickHouse, performance unchanged

### ✅ No Lint Errors
- All files pass TypeScript checks
- No new linter warnings introduced

---

## Changelog

-

---

## Screenshots

-

💯

tests.description: [Antiwork] Update chat auth to allow anonymous sessions with matching s

vars.pr_body:
Fixes #1058 

# Update chat auth to allow anonymous sessions with matching sessionId

## Summary
Updated authentication logic across chat endpoints to use OR instead of AND logic. Previously, anonymous sessions were blocked from accessing conversations that had an `emailFrom` set. Now, access is granted if either:
- The session has a matching `anonymousSessionId` (for anonymous sessions)
- The session has a matching email address (for authenticated sessions)

This change affects 3 endpoints:
- `app/api/chat/route.ts` - Main chat endpoint
- `app/api/chat/conversation/[slug]/message/[id]/route.ts` - Message reactions
- `app/api/chat/conversation/[slug]/message/[id]/event/route.ts` - Message events

The new logic follows the same pattern already used in `app/api/chat/customerFilter.ts`.

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human
- [ ] **Security review**: Verify the OR logic doesn't grant unintended access to conversations
- [ ] **End-to-end testing**: Test with both anonymous and authenticated sessions to ensure proper access control
- [ ] **Edge case testing**: Test scenarios with missing `anonymousSessionId` or `emailFrom` values
- [ ] **Requirements alignment**: Confirm the change matches the original request to allow anonymous sessions with correct sessionId

### Notes
This is a critical authentication change that should be thoroughly tested before deployment. The logic change allows anonymous users to continue accessing conversations even after they provide their email address, as long as they have the correct `anonymousSessionId`.

Link to Devin run: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/686cb024beba4e4682568ce9c307835c
Requested by: reason.koan@gmail.com
